Gotron: Oh yeah?

Gotron draws a blaster.

Gotron: Thanks for helping me prove your point, now close your eyws, as long
as you don't struggle this won't hurt a bit.

Gotron aimed the blaster at Lady Hawk's head...

----- Original Message -----
From: "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, December 20, 2000 10:20 AM
Subject: Re: Lady Hawk again.


> Lady Hawk fealt that Gotron had just proven her point, "You got mad and
> fealt the need to justify what you are, that proves that what I said is
> right.She walked up closer to him, "If we were really a civilized race we
> wouldn't find the need to argue over who or what we are." (Same goes for
> humans.) She remembered her fathers teachings, if every bot followed terms
> of common courtesy then there wouldn't be a need for war.
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: THECODE <thecode@...>
> To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>

> Subject: Re: Lady Hawk again.

> > Gotron suddenly fell furious.
> >
> > Gotron: I was not programmed like that! The Matrix is my creator! The
> Matrix
> > created me to live peacefully, I was programmed to do what I wish to do!
> And
> > I shall do what I wish.

> > Gotron calmed down. He had said what he wanted to say, now.
> >

> wasn't
> > > for war, destinies would never be fulfilled, friendships would never

> creators
> > to
> > > have the talents to fight, and we build the future based on all of our
> > > knowlege. We don't fight because we want to, or even that we have to.
We
> > > wage wars because as a race we are flawed by survival." She wanted to
> tell
> > > him all the times that the same argument was used to defend the need
for
> > war
> > > to her but didn't want to bore her new associate with the boring
